result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zackery S Asher

records.addlTxt:
10:24 AM Defendant Zackery S Asher appeared by video.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Zackery S Asher.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Svehlek - not resolved - continuing investigation, asking for another FPT instead of JT. Court will allow, continues bond, sets for PLEAS on 3/6/23 at 11:00 AM.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 6, 2023 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Zackery S Asher
Current: 11883 Unity Ave, Winston, MO 64689 United States  (Effective: 08-29-2022)
Prior: 1409 Cooper Street, Chillicothe, MO 64601 United States
Conditions as outlined in the attached Order to Modify Bond (Filed 6-23-22) and added condition to allow supervised contact with his step-brother, L.S.

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zackery S Asher appeared by phone.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Zackery S Asher. Judge Kussel appears by video from Shawano County Courtroom. DAR court reporter, AG appears by video. Cour approves video appearance by Mr. Asher due to condition of no use of internet. Svehlek makes statement, is not in a settlement position at this time for reasons as stated on the record. Court will have set for FPT and bond remains in effect. Svehlek would like to address conditions on bond, asks for bond to allow contact with LS, step-brother and must be supervised by family members. State does not object. Court amends bond as requested.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Conditions as outlined in the attached Order to Modify Bond.
to Modify Bond
to Modify Bond
to Modify Bond
to Modify Conditions of Bond
Pre-trial conference on July 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

09:03 AM Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance at 9:00 AM when case was originally called, Attorney Halyburton was on the video and let Attorney Svehlek know that her case was up. Recalled case at 9:03 and Attorney Svehlek now appears but not the defendant. Attorney Svehlek states that she thought the defendant was excused for today's hearing and did inform her client that he appearance today was not necessary, apologizes to the Court, has good communication with the defendant, looks for an email from defendant with his new address. Clerk informs that the defendant called and the Court has his address (Chillicothe, MO). Court defers to State on how to proceed today, won't issue a warrant due to counsel informing him that he did not need to be here today. Svehlek des have a offer from the State which includes pleading to 1 count with minimums, makes statement as it relates to the case (unique case), asks for one additional FPT. State has no objections to an adjournment. Court will allow an adjournment, continues bond, sets for PTC on 7/26/22 at 3:15 PM, defendant can appear remotely unless it turns into a PLEAS. Svehlek reminds Court that the defendant has a bond condition of no use of the internet. Court - Svehlek to possibly do 3-way conference call for the appearance.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Zackery S Asher
Current: 1409 Cooper Street, Chillicothe, MO 64601 United States  (Effective: 04-26-2022)
Prior: 400 W Grant Street Apt 9, Crandon, WI 54520
Pre-trial conference on May 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

02:49 PM Defendant Zackery S Asher appears by video from FC jail with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek also appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stacie Pomrening DAR reporter. Svehlek indicates State provided offer today and asks for PTC date to allow more time to go offer with client.  State agrees. Court has Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:45 am, continues bond.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:33 PM Defendant Zackery S Asher appears by video from FC jail, in custody with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appearing by video. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. Judge Kussel appears by video from Shawano County Courtroom. DAR court reporter, S Pomrening appears by video. State here for ARGN. Court makes sure Asher is waiving his personal appearance. Asher would like to proceed remotely. Svehlek has went over complaint, waives reading, enters pleas of NG to all charges. Court accepts pleas of NG and bond will remain in effect. PTC scheduled for April 21st at 2:30 PM. Svehlek asks if Asher can appear by zoom for that hearing, unsure if she will have resolution as this is an evidentiary case - lots of electronic documents to go over. Court explains process in Shawano County but will waive Asher's appearance entirely for the PTC in April.
Arraignment on March 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

03:31 PM Defendant Zackery S Asher appears by video from Forest County Jail with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek also appearing by video. Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video. Judge Kussel appears by video from Shawano County Courtroom. DAR court reporter, A. Livernash appears by video. State here for PH. Court makes sure defendant is waiving his personal appearance for today's hearing. Asher agrees to proceed remotely. Svehlek had asked for sequestration of witnesses. State calls special agent Chad Racine as first witness. Court swears in, 3:33 PM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of defendant, 3:51 PM. Svehlek cross-examines witness, 3:52 PM. Witness excused, 3:55 PM. State makes final argument and asks for bind over. Svehlek makes final argument, state's case is weak - gaps and delays and feels state did not meet burden of proof. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Court will have ARGN set on March 4, 2022 at 3:30 PM and bond will remain in effect. Adjourned.

records.addlTxt: Must update Clerk of Court's office of any address change within 48 hours of that change, not to access the Internet and not to possess any device capable of accessing the Internet.
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

09:48 AM Defendant Zackery S Asher appears by video from FC jail with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek also appearing by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video.  Svehlek has went over complaint, waives further reading. Svehlek is asking for PH and willing to waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived. Svehlek would like to address bond, makes statement, argues for signature bond. State - believes some cash is warranted and leaves up to the court. Court questions Asher on employment, income and residence. Asher responds, unemployed, unsure of residence and believes wife filed for divorce. Court - will have bond set at $500 cash, with conditions: must update COC of any address change within 48 hours of that change, not to access the Internet and not to possess any device capable of accessing the Internet. PH scheduled for 2/10/22 at 2:45 PM.
for reduction in bond.
Not to go on the internet. No possession of any device capable of accessing the internet.
Cash set
